title: PM Update: Warm this evening; clouds build in and temperatures cool for Monday
text:
A gorgeous day in Columbia, Md. (F150Terp via Flickr)

While very warm (mid- to upper 80s) and pretty humid, at least today gave us a beautiful sky. The unseasonable warmth and humidity will last through this evening, but a shift in wind direction should bring in cooler air and cloudier skies on Monday.

Listen to our daily D.C. forecasts: Apple Podcasts | Amazon Echo | More options

Through Tonight: Clouds increase as this evening progresses, thanks to a wind shift from off the Atlantic (easterly at 5 to 10 mph), and while temperatures fall through the 70s, they won’t drop much lower because of the overcast conditions. Overnight lows generally settle in the mid-60s as humidity levels stay at somewhat uncomfortable levels (dew points in the low 60s).

View the current weather at The Washington Post.

Tomorrow (Monday): The last day of September will be rather uneventful, as we’ll have mostly cloudy skies with the slightest chance of a shower in the afternoon (our far-western areas are most likely to see a shower, although the chance is still quite low). Onshore, southeasterly winds will be light but will support cooler highs in the mid-70s. Humidity will remain much the same.

See Brian Jackson’s forecast through the weekend. And if you haven’t already, join us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. For related traffic news, check out Gridlock.

Record-warm October temperature possible on Wednesday: While record highs for the date (Oct. 2) stand a strong chance of being broken Wednesday, there is an outside chance that we could tie or break the records for all-time warmest October high temperatures for both airports (96 at Reagan and 94 at Dulles). The European model guidance remains more bullish on projecting the hotter highs (94-96), while the American model is more modest (90-92). We’ll have to see whether a consensus emerges as Wednesday draws closer.

description: A warm and tranquil Sunday evening transitions to a cooler and cloudy Monday.
